author: CT
text: Do not sell on Grailed. They're shady. For sellers they claim they charge a 9% fee, but after PayPal fees, the total is closer to 13%. Also, they set up their shipping similar to Poshmark, automatically applying $8, but unlike Poshmark (or Mercari) they don't have a deal with the post office, so if you're package costs more than that, you better change it up front or will it cost you. Better for you to sell on any other platform: Mercari, Poshmark, even Ebay. These other platforms (w/ the exception of Poshmark which at least provides the option) don't post your name & listing on Google. And if you delete your account with Grailed, they'll send you a "song of the week" from MGMT entitled "When You Die" w/ the chorus line "Go F*** Yourself" because they're a bunch of shady, immature guys who lack proper customer service.
title: Grailed is shady. Do not sell on Grailed.

author: Eugene
text:
My Grailed username is "252" and I've been an exemplar seller on the site since 2014 (over 200 transactions and a 5-star rating with many buyers choosing to actually write a few words of praise in addition to leaving five stars). I am one of the sellers on the site who make an effort — whether it comes to the condition, presentation (nice high-resolution photos, good informative descriptions) of the items for sale or good customer service (I always try to communicate with the users in a courteous manner providing them with as much information about the item as I can so they can make the right choice). I do believe it's because of sellers like myself that buyers keep coming back to the site. 

Recently — just when Grailed raised their fees, to hire an army of "moderators" to police the site, it appears — they started permanently removing my items from the site in bulk, up to 10 — 15 at a time, for being listed under what their "moderators" think "an inaccurate designer". How is a jacket made by Junya Watanabe Comme des Garcons in collaboration with Goldwin and listed under "Junya Watanabe", "Comme des Garcons" and "Goldwin" can be considered as listed under "inaccurate designer" is beyond my understanding. The high resolution photos of all the labels inside the jacket were in the listing. 

Deleted for the same reason, "inaccurate designer", a Comme des Garcons Homme sweater listed under "Comme des Garcons", "Comme des Garcons Homme" and "Junya Watanabe". Do their "team of expert moderators" even know Junya Watanabe designs for the Comme Homme line?

The items are removed without warning. You can't  appeal or relist the items unless you do it from scratch. Why not simply send an email to say what it is they find offensive and let us sellers fix the issue? Why not allow to appeal the removal or at least let us relist the original listing? What's their motivation? To punish us? To teach us a lesson?

So much of my time and work has gone into those listings and now everything has gone: the descriptions, the measurements, the photos I had carefully selected. Not even working links or the listings' numbers remain as everything has been deleted permanently.

As is customary with Grailed customer service, there's no one I can contact, no one I can direct this matter to. I wrote one of those emails to their customer support no one ever answers (ticket ID 710140). I wrote to this guy Lennox who works for them. Nice guy, we had exchanged a few messages some time ago, but when I sent him a message a couple of moths ago telling him of Grailed's removal of my listings, he never answered. Wrote to Jordan too but only got a generic reply providing me with yet another ticket ID — 711422 this time.

It's been almost 48 hours since the listings were removed and I started contacting their customer service. No human being has got back to me yet.

If I want to reinstate the listings they remove I have to write the descriptions from scratch. I have to spend hours to reconstruct the descriptions from memory, unpack the item again (I care about the presentation of my items, I don’t just stick them into an envelope and send them off: all my items are carefully wrapped and sealed in paper and stored away waiting to be shipped), measure them again and post them on the site, hoping the new listings don’t get removed yet again because someone somewhere decides anonymously and unequivocally that the “information I provided is inaccurate". 

I feel hounded and harrassed for no reason and if nothing changes I am going to have to leave the site. I understand that my presence on the site might not be that important to Grailed in the grand scheme of things — if I go another dozen sellers might come along. But I believe there aren’t too many of us sellers left on the site who are still putting our time into it trying to make it work — despite what feels like plain disrespect and continued efforts to undermine our work on their part. If this continues we'll all leave eventually.

We sellers are the ones creating content for them. We are the ones providing customer service to the buyers. We photograph our items for sale, we write descriptions, we answer questions. When we make a sale we pay them whatever they decide is fair. We pack the items, we ship them to the US from abroad losing whatever money on postage and packing because no one has cared to include an option to charge extra for international postage on the site. We bear the brunt of the situation if the items go missing or get lost or stolen. You'd think they'd appreciate us. But no, all they do or, at least, the only time I hear from them is when those lovely automatic emails arrive titled "Your Listing Has Been Removed" letting me know an anonymous "expert moderator" has just destroyed my work.
title: Grailed keeps harassing long-time sellers
